alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 12:27PM MDT until July 29 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Grand County in north central Colorado... * Until 330 PM MDT. * At 1227 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the north central portions of the East Troublesome burn area. Up to 0.2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.6 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... north central portions of the East Troublesome burn area of North Central Grand County This includes the following additional locations... Stillwater Pass. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
